title: League of Legends crashes when I load into the map
body:
For the past couple of weeks, I have not been able to play league of legends at all because the game is crashing my computer. I can get through champion select just fine and even the load screen but when the characters are about to drop into the map, my computer gets a black screen and I have to hard reset it to get it back up. I originally thought that it was my Graphics card so I called up EVGA and had it RMA'd. A week later, I put the card in and it still happened. I then thought it could be a bad MOBO so I went and replaced everything except the card and the hard drive. Built myself a new computer and it still happens. I then replaced the hard drive thinking it could have been the culprit. I replaced it and I still get the same problem. I really enjoy playing league but I have spent over $900.00 dollars and I still can't play it. 

Possible answers:
1) No my computer is not overheating. I have monitored the temperatures very closely and they never get into critical temperatures.
2) I have disabled the Xbox DVR function for windows 10 to no help.
3) I have forced my GPU to have a constant voltage as I found on the league forums that that could be a possible fix. 
4) My computer should have more than enough horsepower to play this game at max settings even though I only have them set to medium.

Computer specs:
MOBO: MSI Performance Gaming Intel Z170A LGA 1151 DDR4 USB 3.1 ATX Motherboard (Z170A Krait Gaming 3X)
CPU: Intel BX80677I57600K 7th Gen Core Desktop Processors
RAM: Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB DDR4 3200 C16 for DDR4 Systems - White
PSU: EVGA Supernova G1 750W 120-G1-0750-XR Fully Modular Power Supply
GPU: EVGA EVGA GTX GTX 970 Superclocked 4GB GDDR5 256bit, DVI-I, DVI-D, HDMI, DP SLI Ready Graphics Card (04G-P4-1972-KR) Graphics Cards 04G-P4-1972-KR
OS: Windows 10 Home 64-bit 

I would really appreciate any help that someone has to offer.

replies.body:
Can you hear game sounds when this happens? Try hitting **ALT+ENTER** when you see the black screen, as it could toggle you out of a problematic window mode. If that caused no change, then you'll want to work through our [**framerate troubleshooting guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) in order to confirm your local windows and driver configurations are compatible with League.

Let me know if you continue to experience this.
